001package gbw.melange.common.annotations;
002
003import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;
004
005import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
006import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
007import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
008import java.lang.annotation.Target;
009
010/**
011 * <p>View class.</p>
012 *
013 * @author GustavBW
014 * @version $Id: $Id
015 */
016@Target(ElementType.TYPE)
017@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
018@Component //NB: This annotation is only marked with Component so Spring stops complaining. Discovery of Views is manual using Reflections
019public @interface View {
020    enum FocusPolicy {
021        /**
022         * Allow the latest view behind this.
023         */
024        RETAIN_LATEST,
025        /**
026         * Allow all views behind this, in same order.
027         */
028        RETAIN_ALL,
029        /**
030         * Allow no views but this one when focused
031         */
032        OPAQUE;
033    }
034
035    int HOME_SCREEN_LAYER = -1;
036    int DEFAULT_LAYER = 0;
037    FocusPolicy DEFAULT_FOCUS_POLICY = FocusPolicy.OPAQUE;
038    /**
039     * Render ordering, a higher value is more in the background, a layer of -1 is the top, initially user-facing view. <br/>
040     * <pre>
041     *     {@code
042     *     @View( layer = 1 )
043     *     public class SomeView { ... }
044     *     }
045     * </pre>
046     *
047     */
048    int layer() default DEFAULT_LAYER;
049    /**
050     * When this View is brought into focus, what should happen to the rest
051     */
052    FocusPolicy focusPolicy() default FocusPolicy.OPAQUE; //Java won't let me do DEFAULT_FOCUS_POLICY = ... and reference that here. :(
053}
